title: Nika riots in Constantinople.
text: • 532 – Nika riots in Constantinople.

title: Sicut Dudum, forbidding the enslavement of the Guanche natives in Canary Islands by the Spanish, is promulgated by Pope Eugene IV.
text: • 1435 – Sicut Dudum, forbidding the enslavement of the Guanche natives in Canary Islands by the Spanish, is promulgated by Pope Eugene IV.

title: Henry Howard, Earl of Surrey is sentenced to death.
text: • 1547 – Henry Howard, Earl of Surrey is sentenced to death.

title: The Bank of Genoa fails after announcement of national bankruptcy in Spain.
text: • 1607 – The Bank of Genoa fails after announcement of national bankruptcy in Spain.

title: Nicolas Jean Hugon de Bassville, representative of Revolutionary France, lynched by a mob in Rome
text: • 1793 – Nicolas Jean Hugon de Bassville, representative of Revolutionary France, lynched by a mob in Rome

title: French Revolutionary Wars: A naval battle between a French ship of the line and two British frigates off the coast of Brittany ends with the French vessel running aground, resulting in over 900 deaths.
text: • 1797 – French Revolutionary Wars: A naval battle between a French ship of the line and two British frigates off the coast of Brittany ends with the French vessel running aground, resulting in over 900 deaths.

title: War of 1812: British troops capture Fort Peter in St. Marys, Georgia, the only battle of the war to take place in the state.
text: • 1815 – War of 1812: British troops capture Fort Peter in St. Marys, Georgia, the only battle of the war to take place in the state.

title: The design of the Greek flag is adopted by the First National Assembly at Epidaurus.
text: • 1822 – The design of the Greek flag is adopted by the First National Assembly at Epidaurus.

title: The Great Fire of New Orleans begins.
text: • 1830 – The Great Fire of New Orleans begins.

title: United States President Andrew Jackson writes to Vice President Martin Van Buren expressing his opposition to South Carolina's defiance of federal authority in the Nullification Crisis.
text: • 1833 – United States President Andrew Jackson writes to Vice President Martin Van Buren expressing his opposition to South Carolina's defiance of federal authority in the Nullification Crisis.

title: The steamship Lexington burns and sinks four miles off the coast of Long Island with the loss of 139 lives.
text: • 1840 – The steamship Lexington burns and sinks four miles off the coast of Long Island with the loss of 139 lives.

title: Dr. William Brydon, an assistant surgeon in the British East India Company Army during the First Anglo
text: • 1842 – Dr. William Brydon, an assistant surgeon in the British East India Company Army during the First Anglo-Afghan War, becomes famous for being the sole survivor of an army of 4,500 men and 12,000 camp followers when he reaches the safety of a garrison in Jalalabad, Afghanistan.

title: The Treaty of Cahuenga ends the Mexican
text: • 1847 – The Treaty of Cahuenga ends the Mexican–American War in California.

title: Establishment of the Colony of Vancouver Island.
text: • 1849 – Establishment of the Colony of Vancouver Island.

title: Second Anglo
text: • 1849 - Second Anglo-Sikh War – Battle of Tooele: British forces retreat from the Sikhs.

title: In Mozart Gardens Brooklyn Ada Anderson completed a great feat of pedestrianism
text: • 1879 – In Mozart Gardens Brooklyn Ada Anderson completed a great feat of pedestrianism - 2700 quarter miles in 2700 quarter hours, earning her $8000.

title: The National Geographic Society is founded in Washington, D.C.
text: • 1888 – The National Geographic Society is founded in Washington, D.C.

title: The Independent Labour Party of the United Kingdom holds its first meeting.
text: • 1893 – The Independent Labour Party of the United Kingdom holds its first meeting.

title: U.S. Marines land in Honolulu, Hawaii from the USS Boston to prevent the queen from abrogating the Bayonet Constitution.
text: • 1893 – U.S. Marines land in Honolulu, Hawaii from the USS Boston to prevent the queen from abrogating the Bayonet Constitution.

title: First Italo
text: • 1895 – First Italo-Ethiopian War: the war's opening battle, the Battle of Coatit, occurs; it is an Italian victory.

title: Émile Zola's J'accuse…! exposes the Dreyfus affair.
text: • 1898 – Émile Zola's J'accuse…! exposes the Dreyfus affair.

title: The Rhoads Opera House fire in Boyertown, Pennsylvania kills 171 people.
text: • 1908 – The Rhoads Opera House fire in Boyertown, Pennsylvania kills 171 people.

title: The first public radio broadcast takes place; a live performance of the operas Cavalleria rusticana and Pagliacci are sent out over the airwaves from the Metropolitan Opera House in New York.
text: • 1910 – The first public radio broadcast takes place; a live performance of the operas Cavalleria rusticana and Pagliacci are sent out over the airwaves from the Metropolitan Opera House in New York.

title: The 6.7 Mw Avezzano earthquake shakes the Province of L'Aquila in Italy with a maximum Mercalli intensity of XI (Extreme), killing between 29,978
text: • 1915 – The 6.7 Mw Avezzano earthquake shakes the Province of L'Aquila in Italy with a maximum Mercalli intensity of XI (Extreme), killing between 29,978–32,610.

title: A plebiscite in Saarland shows that 90.3% of those voting wish to join Nazi Germany.
text: • 1935 – A plebiscite in Saarland shows that 90.3% of those voting wish to join Nazi Germany.

title: The Black Friday bush fires burn 20,000 square kilometers of land in Australia, claiming the lives of 71 people.
text: • 1939 – The Black Friday bush fires burn 20,000 square kilometers of land in Australia, claiming the lives of 71 people.

title: Henry Ford patents a plastic automobile, which is 30% lighter than a regular car.
text: • 1942 – Henry Ford patents a plastic automobile, which is 30% lighter than a regular car.

title: World War II: First use of an aircraft ejection seat by a German test pilot in a Heinkel He 280 jet fighter.
text: • 1942 – World War II: First use of an aircraft ejection seat by a German test pilot in a Heinkel He 280 jet fighter.

title: British submarine HMS Truculent collides with an oil tanker in the Thames Estuary, killing 64 men.
text: • 1950 – British submarine HMS Truculent collides with an oil tanker in the Thames Estuary, killing 64 men.

title: Finland forms diplomatic relations with the People's Republic of China.
text: • 1950 - Finland forms diplomatic relations with the People's Republic of China.

title: First Indochina War: The Battle of Vĩnh Yên begins.
text: • 1951 – First Indochina War: The Battle of Vĩnh Yên begins.

title: An article appears in Pravda accusing some of the most prestigious and prominent doctors, mostly Jews, in the Soviet Union of taking part in a vast plot to poison members of the top Soviet political and military leadership.
text: • 1953 – An article appears in Pravda accusing some of the most prestigious and prominent doctors, mostly Jews, in the Soviet Union of taking part in a vast plot to poison members of the top Soviet political and military leadership.

title: The Moroccan Army of Liberation ambushes a Spanish patrol in the Battle of Edchera.
text: • 1958 – The Moroccan Army of Liberation ambushes a Spanish patrol in the Battle of Edchera.

title: Coup d'état in Togo results in the assassination of president Sylvanus Olympio.
text: • 1963 – Coup d'état in Togo results in the assassination of president Sylvanus Olympio.

title: Anti
text: • 1964 – Anti-Muslim riots break out in Calcutta, resulting in 100 deaths.

title: In Manchester, New Hampshire, fourteen
text: • 1964 - In Manchester, New Hampshire, fourteen-year-old Pamela Mason is murdered. Edward Coolidge is tried and convicted of the crime, but the conviction is set aside by the landmark Fourth Amendment case Coolidge v. New Hampshire (1971).

title: Robert C. Weaver becomes the first African American Cabinet member when he is appointed United States Secretary of Housing and Urban Development.
text: • 1966 – Robert C. Weaver becomes the first African American Cabinet member when he is appointed United States Secretary of Housing and Urban Development.

title: Johnny Cash performs live at Folsom State Prison.
text: • 1968 – Johnny Cash performs live at Folsom State Prison.

title: Prime Minister Kofi Abrefa Busia and President Edward Akufo
text: • 1972 – Prime Minister Kofi Abrefa Busia and President Edward Akufo-Addo of Ghana are ousted in a bloodless military coup by Colonel Ignatius Kutu Acheampong.

title: Seraphim is elected Archbishop of Athens and All Greece.
text: • 1974 – Seraphim is elected Archbishop of Athens and All Greece.

title: United States Food and Drug Administration requires all blood donations to be labeled "paid" or "volunteer" donors.
text: • 1978 – United States Food and Drug Administration requires all blood donations to be labeled "paid" or "volunteer" donors.

title: Shortly after takeoff, Air Florida Flight 90, a Boeing 737 jet, crashes into Washington, D.C.'s 14th Street Bridge and falls into the Potomac River, killing 78 including four motorists.
text: • 1982 – Shortly after takeoff, Air Florida Flight 90, a Boeing 737 jet, crashes into Washington, D.C.'s 14th Street Bridge and falls into the Potomac River, killing 78 including four motorists.

title: A passenger train plunges into a ravine in Ethiopia, killing 428 in the worst railroad disaster in Africa.
text: • 1985 – A passenger train plunges into a ravine in Ethiopia, killing 428 in the worst railroad disaster in Africa.

title: A month
text: • 1986 – A month-long violent struggle begins in Aden, South Yemen between supporters of Ali Nasir Muhammad and Abdul Fattah Ismail, resulting in thousands of casualties.

title: Lee Teng
text: • 1988 – Lee Teng-hui becomes the first native Taiwanese President of the Republic of China.

title: Douglas Wilder becomes the first elected African American governor as he takes office in Richmond, Virginia.
text: • 1990 – Douglas Wilder becomes the first elected African American governor as he takes office in Richmond, Virginia.

title: Soviet Union troops attack Lithuanian independence supporters in Vilnius, killing 14 people and wounding around 1000 others.
text: • 1991 – Soviet Union troops attack Lithuanian independence supporters in Vilnius, killing 14 people and wounding around 1000 others.

title: Space Shuttle program: Endeavour heads for space for the third time as STS
text: • 1993 – Space Shuttle program: Endeavour heads for space for the third time as STS-54 launches from the Kennedy Space Center.

title: The Chemical Weapons Convention (CWC) is signed.[1]
text: • 1993 - The Chemical Weapons Convention (CWC) is signed.[1]

title: Alfredo Ormando sets himself on fire in St. Peter's Square, protesting against homophobia.
text: • 1998 – Alfredo Ormando sets himself on fire in St. Peter's Square, protesting against homophobia.

title: An earthquake hits El Salvador, killing more than 800.
text: • 2001 – An earthquake hits El Salvador, killing more than 800.

title: The passenger cruise ship Costa Concordia sinks off the coast of Italy due to the captain Francesco Schettino's negligence and irresponsibility. There are 32 confirmed deaths.
text: • 2012 – The passenger cruise ship Costa Concordia sinks off the coast of Italy due to the captain Francesco Schettino's negligence and irresponsibility. There are 32 confirmed deaths.

title: A false emergency alert warning of an impending missile strike in Hawaii caused widespread panic in the state.
text: • 2018 – A false emergency alert warning of an impending missile strike in Hawaii caused widespread panic in the state.
